page.title: 13HOUSING
page.content: Burgess Hill expanded rapidly when the railway was built in 1841. Up to that time it was mainly a farming area. Great changes have taken place within the past twenty years. Most housing is{owner occupied}but there are some{council properties.} On the fringe of the town there are some very old houses possibly from the Elizabethan period. Within the town there are many{Victorian terraced} houses, which were originally occupied by railway and pottery workers. The landscape has been changed by the construction of three high rise office blocks in the centre of the town, and the{redevelopment}of the brickyards to a largely{pedestrianised shopping precinct and open market. Development of new housing estates is gradually eroding the open spaces in and arounnd the outskirts of the town.
